website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills, basic Trimline phone that works even when the electricity is out, but not best choice for wall-mounted phone.
pros: Programmable with 3 one-touch memory buttons and 13 speed-dial numbers
cons: Doesn't work well as wall-mounted phone

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the past!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats copper for voice clarity and power outages! This is one of those indestructible relics of last-century POTS technology that I haven't abandoned. (During the ten-day post-Hurricane Wilma apocalypse, my dangling land line was my only surviving connection to the civilized world!). This replacement will probably outlast me! This phone appears to the old standard issue AT&T Trimline phone, but lacks the information/instructions for WALL MOUNTING. (See attached). There is a plastic tab on the base (under the label) that needs to be slid out and flipped over, to hold the phone on the cradle in the hanging position.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Desktop Touch Tone Landline Telephone! Have Purchased at Least Four of These!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars! This is the best touch-tone landline desktop landline telephone that I have seen on the market in the past 18 years! I have now purchased at least four of these phones. It is well-designed, well-built, and best of all, it is robust enough and heavy enough that it sits in a stable fashion on a desktop or other surface. Even better, unlike so many of the competing models of desktop touch tone phones, this phone does NOT need any batteries, which are so common on other phones because they are needed to enable al sorts of stupid and unwanted bells and whistles to work. Great phone. Will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value wall phone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value; replaces an identical phone that we have had for more than 15 years. Ringer is fully adjustable. Very easy to install on the wall (read the simple directions on the simple one-step way to make it a wall phone). Cord is a little short, but for under $10, you cannot beat this phone. No reason to buy a more expensive wall phone. We especially like that the numbers are in the handset, and not on the wall unit on which the handset is held.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald B. Leedom

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't expecting an iPhone, but assumed it would work, at least.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to perform as emergency home phone. It's a simple enough and tested design (old enough to have owned several throughout my childhood) and didn't think to try it out beyond listening for a dial tone until I had an emergency....and couldn't dial out. None of the buttons work. Absolutely useless waste of space and money and too late to return. Sad to say I wish I had a lesser emergency a month ago...
customer_reviews.author: Jilligan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed. A landline that is affordable and clear
customer_reviews.text: I use a landline for my home office and for my podcast recordings. I need a phone that is easy to use, doesn't have the problems with needless static and that is affordable. This one I found online and decided to give a try. I use AT&T for my phone and internet services so I thought it would be a good bet the phone itself would work well. It's easy to use and sounds great. Just what I needed and I haven't had the problem with the cord getting crazy tied up after each use. Definitely serving the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Webb

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Phone works perfect. We needed another phone downstairs that would work during a power outage, and it does. I decorated it to be prettier, otherwise it is fine the way it looks sold. I do wish that I could adjust the volume even lower, some people who call are so loud I have to keep the phone away from my ear, and I have the volume control set on the lowest setting. Coil cords have their downsides, but this one does pretty decent at not tangling enough to rip the body off the wall! (And I have it mounted with a command strip).
customer_reviews.author: V.C.J

customer_reviews.title: The earpiece didn't work, & the phone needed to be returned.  :-(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly mom in a nursing home in a different state. When I called her after the maintenance people installed it, she picked up the phone but could not hear my voice...which confused her. I called maintenance the next day to check it out, and they found that any user of the phone was unable to hear the voice of the person at the other end (though I could hear my mom's voice on it...not that that matters, I suppose). The staff (who handles a lot of different residents' phones) also said that the feel of the product seemed chintzy and recommended that I purchase a different product as a replacement. That is what I did.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Number buttons don't work
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Number buttons don't work, so we can't call out. Thought this would be a good backup landline phone during the hurricane... now we are just stuck with our cell phones till the battery runs out. Dial tone was only heard occasionally. They just don't make phones like they used to... this is a cheaply made piece of junk. Even the felt stickers at the bottom of the phone was not placed where it should be. Simply terrible!!!
customer_reviews.author: Axelay

customer_reviews.title: Not a wall hanging phone
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware even though the description says it is able to be used as a wall hanging phone, this is completely inaccurate. I tried hanging it but the receiver falls off the base. If you plan on buying this phone just realize it can only be used sitting on a counter or other flat surface not as a wall hanging phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jon T Beezley

customer_reviews.title: Not rugged, but good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Mine held up well for about five years, and since it got daily use (and a few drops on the floor), I consider that service enough for less than ten bucks. Matching white (not beige) extension or line cords to it is easy enough. Be aware it has no special features to speak of, except for multi-number memory.
customer_reviews.author: Allen SmallingTop Contributor: Classical Music

customer_reviews.title: The lighted keypad does NOT light up
customer_reviews.text: 4.27.20 I bought this phone in Jan 2019 as an extra. Just started using it. My biggest problem with it is that the keypad does NOT light up. I have to use a flashlight to see the keypad. It's ok with sound and it's heavier than some phones I've held. If keypad would light up or if the numbers on keypad were somehow brighter, I would be more apt to recommend. Perhaps I wrote a review previously and said I liked the phone; that was before I tried it in a dimly lighted room. No, I dont plan to order another one... KayM 4.27.20
customer_reviews.author: KayM

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money--spend money on a better phone.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible phone. Not only is it hard to get it to stay on the adjustable hook--which gets bumped with each use to you have to re-play with it to get the correct fit--but the static is terrible. I kept blaming the phone line, and finally got the phone company to come out today to work on the line. Turned out, two other phones tried on the line worked perfectly. Went back to the ancient rotary-dial desktop phone we got at the thrift store. Don't waste your money--spend more for a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi the Homeschool Mom

customer_reviews.title: Really regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This phone looks good and fit the description for my needs completely. Wanted a landline phone that did not require electric connection. Purchased end of June, quit working by the end of July! In fact, it was shorting out my household phone lines and none of my 4 other phone locations in the house would function. Phone company made house call and was able to determine all problems caused by this new AT&T phone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. That old saying of “you get what you pay for” is certainly true with this phone. I should have known the great price was too good to be true. Has so much static or noise on the phone that is difficult to hear or have a conversation.
customer_reviews.author: xx

customer_reviews.title: Missing phone cord
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived without the coiled handset cord. I had ordered this for an older person with a compromised immune system who is home alone in a remote location. Her cell phone broke, and this phone would be her only means of voice communication. Now she will be forced to go to Home Depot to try and get the missing cord, which will put her health in jeopardy. This was supposed to be a new item. I understand that this is a challenging time, but to ship an item with missing parts is unacceptable at any time. But it’s even more important to check quality control now.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Carsburg

customer_reviews.title: No external pwr. needed, basic wired/corded push-button phone.
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. Plug it in and go. No pwr. required as it gets all it needs from the telco phone line. Has ringer volume adjust, phone volume adjust, switch(able) between pulse-code (rotary) and touch-tone. Its a no-frills, basic, easy-to-use phone that will work even if your electricity goes out (because it doesn't plug in to the electrical wall socket). Perfect for the minimalist, Luddite, old-school, pre-internet, user/application. It just works, period, 'nuf said. Update: 03-May-2020. OK, not enough said. Upon further use, noticed that the sound quality was a bit lacking, in that voices sound muffled like someone has a cold (no, its NOT COVID-19!). Therefore I dropped the rating to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: ok phone, not everything works
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a decent enough phone. I keep my landline because my hearing is bad and I appreciate the sound quality, and I've never gotten used to the walkie-talkie type communication of cell phones. The 3 one button dialing buttons don't work, I followed the directions (not poorly translated Chinese for once!) and they don't work. The price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Waisanen

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: I had a wall-mounted landline phone for years, until it finally died. Unfortunately, it isn't anywhere near an outlet so I couldn't replace it with a portable phone, and there's nowhere in the kitchen that is near an outlet that is in a convenient place. So I was kind of stuck getting a phone like this one. The sound quality isn't very good, but then it was either live with it or not have a phone in the kitchen (and have to dig the mount out of the wall and fill in a rather large hole). So I guess I'm glad that there is even a phone like this still available, but I wish it was better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Needed backup phone.
customer_reviews.text: We need a land line without answering machine when power goes out. This ringtone is one that we can hear, replacing the other one that was failing. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jj Williams

customer_reviews.title: Audio clarity to die for - and almost perplexingly inexpensive! :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend as a replacement for a gremlin-infested corded phone that had been producing barely intelligible sounds - possibly in Klingon. He reports crystal-clear sound -- absent garbling, echoes from a distant galaxy, intermittent banshee-like wails, and the occasional sound of someone burping, "Qapla'" -- so I have to consider the purchase a success (and an astonishingly good buy, for only ten bucks). Too, he has been relieved of the burden of learning Klingon. So... Qapla'! (I recommend this item for use on Earth, and make no representations respecting its functionality in another galaxy. :))
customer_reviews.author: video meliora proboque

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Works! Good for trouble shooting
customer_reviews.text: My phone line comes from my cable TV provider through a modem. I bought this phone for trouble shooting: to see if there's a problem with the service provider or my house phones. There are times when you need a simple handset to diagnose phone problems and this fits the bill and was cheap. I'm sure there are plenty of 50 year old princes phones still out in the world and I wouldn't compare the quality of this unit with those. This one probably could not survive several generations of abuse like the old ones could. But it's cheap, it works, and I'm sure it would last for years of normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Pep

customer_reviews.title: A Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I am eighty-one, live alone, and had a telephone jack installed in my bedroom, since the only other telephone was several rooms away in my family room. Not long after this phone arrived, I had a power outage, which usually doesn't affect my phone service. I went into the family room to call my daughter, but the line didn't work! I had had phone work done a couple of months ago and they had apparently disconnected it when they installed the new jack in my bedroom! I got out the new phone, plugged it in, called my daughter, and breathed a sigh of relief!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: It works I guess
customer_reviews.text: Well it works but they are not made like they used to be! Buttons light but barely visible even in the dark. I bought this as a tester phone since we have portable phones throughout the house but are having some line trouble. Prior to having a tech come out they want you to test at the box at the side of the house. I bought this to do that. It did help answer the question of is the noise coming from the incoming line or the wires inside the house. Survey says....it is inside. So it worked for its $10 purpose but other than that ?????
customer_reviews.author: coinhound

customer_reviews.title: Not what they once were
customer_reviews.text: I got this to have a back-up when electricity fails in my house up north in rural Minnesota. However, I have found it to be very picky regarding which outlets it will and will not work in. I finally found one to be consistent and will keep it there. Don't expect this to be like the phones you may have grown up with in the 70s or 80s. These are very cheaply made, have virtually no weight to them and I would not expect it to live up to performing after being dropped off of a counter top on to my kitchen floor.
customer_reviews.author: awilli

customer_reviews.title: Chunky and heavy but works and has 3 ring volumes
customer_reviews.text: The good news the phone works as expected. The not so good news is that the phone is very chunky and heavy. It is not easy to fit in the hand very comfortably but there are a limited number of wall phone choices and some don't have options on ringer volume. This phone does have three settings so that is a positive also.
customer_reviews.author: houseofwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have two other phones that are about 26 years older than this one. They weigh more because they are not fully solid state and as such have heavier transformers in them. This unit is so light weight, it's like lifting a cloud. It's very reliable and the push button touch is great the way the keys respond. I'm 62, with 30% loss of hearing in both my ears, but I hear just fine with this phone, even though it has no volume adjustment. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: The Night Falcon

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine for wall mounting if one notices a nearly invisible piece designed to keep the hand set in place.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be good value for the money. But it's hard to say I love it -- yet anyway. A mystery is the abundance of wire between the wall jack and the cradle. On our prior (essentially the same) phone it would be described in inches, not feet. The cradle has plenty of room to store it, but I don't understand why there's so much. Recalling several complaints about the hand set's refusing to stay in the wall-mounted cradle, I was upset to encounter the same problem. Then I noticed a barely-visible(!) small, adjustable piece of the cradle designed to solve that very problem. Voila!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Field, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very basic phone as stated in description
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wired phone for my house so it wouldn't get lost so I opted for this basic old school phone. It's lightweight and does not require electric. The sound quality is horrible though. You can hear an echo in the earpiece even with the volume turned to low. There aren't many switches on it and the ringer is loud enough for us to hear without being alarming. Decent for short phone calls or as a back up phone. We all use cell phones and this is just so we have a phone in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Spoiled Rott'n

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last a Year
customer_reviews.text: It's June 2018, I bought this in August last year, and it's already dead. It's barely been used, I kept it as an emergency landline phone, as we went through multiple wildfires in our area last year and the power was cut to our neighborhood during the fires that got closest, so I didn't receive the evac call when the time came. Buy something better if you're using this for an emergency. I'm not even sure when it died, or why, as it was handled incredibly gently the two whole times I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Dove

customer_reviews.title: Great retro phone for a land line
customer_reviews.text: Great retro phone for a land line. The wall phone in the kitchen finally bit the dust. Did not want to replace it with a larger more expensive phone nor did I want to leave the exposed wall plate so I replaced it with this slim retro phone. Covers the wall plate & works well for taking a quick call from the kitchen. Not the main phone system in the house but it got the job done for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan

customer_reviews.title: Simple phone
customer_reviews.text: Hey Amazon: You ask about battery life: there is no battery in this. In the old days, CORDED phones got their power from the phone line (think caveman POE). That's why I have it. Wildfire tookout all cell service and home electricity. The ONLY thing that worked was my corded phone. While I understand that the ATT corded service is going away (too expensive to maintain) as long as it exists in my part of the world, I will have a corded phone as backup. Big easy top read buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Wood_fly

customer_reviews.title: Soft light cream color, heavy weight, CLEAR and STRONG voice reception - excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Radio Shacks in Bellingham WA have been closing...so thought why not Amazon. This particular "princess phone" is not light weight and flimsy as the ones were at Radio Shack...this one is very well-priced and well-made. Has some weight to it...Really like it. The white is actually a soft cream color. Not the stark industrial white that blinds everyone in the room. Maybe this phone is made better because it is an AT&T phone? The sound is wonderful, clear, strong. What a bargain, Good-Bye to Radio Shack!! And their higher prices. Very pleased, would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: lam

customer_reviews.title: Communication reliability in emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to back up my telephone service in case of a loss of electric power.. The current wall phone configurations (cordless) will not work in the event of a power failure. This could very well be a life saving device in the event of a power failure. Most people today use cell phones for this purpose but need to keep their cell phone battery charged up 24/7. In contrast the standard wired wall phone is always ready to go. Caution though - some standard telephone wired outlets have been changed to cordless and will only work while the power is on. Check with your telephone company if you have an doubts.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pepoon

customer_reviews.title: EVERYONE NEEDS A CORDED PHONE!
customer_reviews.text: I have at least six phones in my 3,000 SF house that operate off of two base stations. It's very convenient -- but did you know that if you lose power (or cell towers), you could be without any telephone service? It pays to have at least one corded phone hooked up directly to the lines to the phone company or the cable company, as I do. In case of an emergency, you have another option for staying in touch. This is a nice inexpensive phone that does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Meier Wright

customer_reviews.title: works like the old however lighter
customer_reviews.text: So I have one 30 years old and it fell and broke. Whatever... its 30 years old and broke. Yea, So got the same one here blah Blah Blah . works the same but nice and new. sure it may not last 30 years but neither will I, so there is that. Let someone else worry about it later, right? Blah Blah you get the point. I'll keep you updated when I can remember to. Wait? What I'm I writing this for? Ok ok right. Got it . Its delicious. you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Grandma is Happy
customer_reviews.text: OK bought this for my "Work Wife" as her Grandma had a cordless/electric phone and somehow kept blocking her daughter from calling ( hmmm may be something to that lol) ok anyway now Grandma has a wired always working phone without high tech stuff. ( PS Grandma lives in a very crappy WEATHER AREA) So now no worries during power outages of needing 911!!! Now Momma and Work Wife are very relieved. Oh and of course a great price !!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Monical

customer_reviews.title: Attachments dont fit
customer_reviews.text: The phone itself is fine but the additional line you can use as an extender (so the phone can reach further) does not fit — the ends are too wide for the opening on the phone. Its actually a phone issue not a cord issue...it is not a standard fit. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Ask Granny

customer_reviews.title: not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Phone has a voice echo when talking on it. I bought it for my other phone extension line but when disconnected my primary phone works great. when extension phone line on both phones have a voice echo. I will just keep primary phone on and keep extension line disconnected until I get a much better phone. The cheap price told me about the quality and should of listen to my judgement. Not worth returning. My primary phone is a emerson phone now over 15 years and going strong
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: A basic corded phone that works
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a basic corded phone to use for emergency 911 calls and this fit the bill. No batteries to worry about and doesn’t need electricity to work. Just plug it into the jack and you’re good to go. No extra features to worry about either, which is perfect for kids who might need to call 911. The keypad also has a backlight. This particular design has been around for many years and it’s perfect for a basic emergency phone.
customer_reviews.author: Browncoats Unite!Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: It's usable but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Yes I still have a land line. Why? I can't really answer that one for you. The buttons on my phone started to go so I set out on a quest to get a corded phone that could hang on the wall. Not as easy as it sounds. I ended up purchasing this phone. It's very cheaply made and doesn't feel solid in my hand. But since the phone is rarely used because its a landline I kept it. There are so few choices for corded phones that something is better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Put It On A Table, Not On The Wall!
customer_reviews.text: This phone works well if you are going to put it on an end table or night stand, but as a wall phone it leaves a lot to be desired. I tried using it as a wall phone in our kitchen but couldn't get the phone to stay on the hook. After about a half hour of fussing with it, I put the old phone back up and put this phone in the basement. I'm pretty disappointed. Seems like buying a good phone is becoming pretty hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Works well, for what it was purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Our internet service comes with a “land line“ number. I wanted a phone that could be used to call the outside world, without using our cell phones. This works so well, that we received 4 sales calls within an hour of activating the number!! I finally turned off the ringer. It gives us a potential phone number to share with people who are looking to call us with promotional calls. It also gives our teenage grandchildren a phone to call their parents, when there is no cell phone available.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma29

customer_reviews.title: Can't be used as a wall mounted phone.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a wall hung Trimline phone. The base has the required cutouts that allow it to be mounted to the wall fixture. Unfortunately, it's missing the little lips on the base and handset that allow it to be used that way. The handset falls off the base if you try to use it as a wall mount. I can't see where this is mentioned in the description. So while the phone appears well made and operates fine, this didn't work for me as I needed one that could be wall mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Creamer

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 70-something year old Mom with health problems and lives alone so when her power goes out her home cordless phone doesn't work.... so I got her this phone and plugged into an old phone jack and it works good... she doesn't use it that much though but it works in case of emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: SFGGate

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay put in vertical position
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple phone that does not require electrical input, and this was a great choice and price. However it does not stay put when on the wall.. The description of product says that it can be mounted on the wall. It does not work that way. Will ask for replacement and write an update here. Update: The replacement came, but has the same problem: does not stay put when mounted on the wall. Returning it for good.
customer_reviews.author: kalyani1008

customer_reviews.title: Programming Numbers Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Although I was finally able to program "911", it was impossible to program other numbers for Memory Dialing.....I followed the step-by-step instructions VERY carefully numerous times, but the number would never be added to the location I selected. It's a cheap phone, so for my purpose of having a bedside phone for calling 911 in an emergency, it's adequate. It's also possible to manually dial other phone numbers. The Mute function doesn't work, but the Redial does. I would not recommend this phone if you want Memory Dialing function and Mute.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Glad I have 2 AT&T 205 models from a few years back. I thought this would be nice for an elder relative. The lights do not all light up and it would be difficult in the dark to read the #1 button, emergency numbers and 9 button. Amazon was kind to send a replacement but the same thing occurred. Have to use a flash light if the power goes out. Wall mount nice. Other than lights would of been ok
customer_reviews.author: North Country

customer_reviews.title: Second One Worked Fine.
customer_reviews.text: The first one had no dial tone, However, with Amazon's return policy, it was a snap to return it and a replacement came the next day. It worked fine. I was not surprised, as reading the reviews before I purchased indicated this was a fairly common problem. Still a good deal for $13.00. I'm thinking of buying another one - - even though I may have to send it back too and wait a day for the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Stammerjohan

customer_reviews.title: Not the same phone from the past
customer_reviews.text: I always liked the Trimline phone but I want people to know there is a difference between this model and ones you may have had in the past. They have made the base part of this phone so light now that it's somewhat of a problem. The phone is the same in all other aspects, but the base of the phone is so light it gets pulled off the table when you use the handset part. I would recommend getting a longer cord so when you answer the phone the base doesn't slide off the table. (If you're using this as a wall-mounted phone, this is not an issue.)
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mason

customer_reviews.title: For the young at heart.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of a landline phone over the last year. I long for a phone without problems and these are static free and without needless problems. Although very rarely seen anymore they are hard working, durable phones. Sure, I can’t walk around with them and they don’t have caller ID, I don’t need that, all the other phones in the house announce who is calling. It is just nice to sit down and have a short chat on a phone with a cord. Reminds me of when I was young.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: This is junk
customer_reviews.text: Setup to use for emergency hardline. Dead. It's junk, run from the pile of trash.
customer_reviews.author: J.A. Brony

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: It works so well, that my elderly parent who has vascular dementia, remembered how to call 911. The volume control is exceptional. The 911 operator heard my mother faking chest pains. The emergency personnel arrived, and she explained she was hoping they would give her a ride to the resort town a few hours away. It's a great phone, and she used it just enough to get in trouble. She no longer has this lovely phone in her residence. We highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kris P.  Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this phone for my Grandparents and it 2 months before it started not working. They would have to push the bottom to hang up the phone multiple times to even get a dial tone. We ended up buying a new phone. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe K.

customer_reviews.title: Too big & ugly!!
customer_reviews.text: Our old Uniden Slimline needed to get replaced and since I couldn’t find another similar, corded phone I went for the AT&T phone instead. It didn’t take me many seconds to realize that the AT&T phone needs to be sent back! Lol It’s too big & bulky, has a cheap plastic feeling to it...really ugly! Now I’ll just keep my old phone instead...it still looks (and feels!) better than the AT&T one.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Mixed opinion
customer_reviews.text: It was a $10 phone so I shouldn’t expect much. I thought it was working fine but what I discovered after it was too late to return it was that I was unable to use the push button feature when trying to respond to surveys or automatic phone systems. I could receive calls and use the push buttons to dial out, though. So if you just need another phone, it’s OK for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: A good phone
customer_reviews.text: This telephone works well. One note of caution: if you plan to install it on a wall receptacle. you must make a small conversion to enable a hook on which to hang the handset. Take care to read the instructions carefully and use a sturdy paper clip. A tiny clip will bend before moving the plastic. Then you will invert a small piece of plastic on the base. Otherwise the hand set will not stay in the upright position.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome A. Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hear people over the buzz...
customer_reviews.text: I get it... it's one of the least expensive corded phones on Amazon. Expectations were low from the get-go. But this phone creates a continuous medium-volume buzzing sound that can be heard on both ends of the call. I wouldn't buy again; If I could go back, I'd probably try my luck and spend an extra $5-10. Hopefully the buzzing will annoy the telemarketers enough to keep them from calling, seeing as how they are the only ones who call. lol!
customer_reviews.author: Dandan

customer_reviews.title: Phone stopped working after 10 months of very infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for a vacation property. Worked fine until today. Only way to get a dial tone is to unplug the telephone cable from the wall or phone. But then can't disconnect after a call is made. Which then doesn't allow other calls in because the phone is "off the hook". Incredibly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: it's a phone
customer_reviews.text: works fine, durable even though dropped repeatedly. My father kept trying to answer the tv remote, and change the phone channel with a cordless phone. This phone looks and handles like a phone, so is better for those confusing assorted cordless items, remotes, etc. It also hangs up the line when put back in the cradle, unlike cordless phones which must be hung up manually. Also likely more durable
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but not cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This is still a simple, basic phone that works. It is inexpensive, but it isn't cheap. It won't remember your birthday or call your ex-wife for you, and it doesn't have a digital readout of the weather report and all your friends' shoe sizes, but if you need to make or receive a phone call, it will work every time, and even a dummy like me can use it!
customer_reviews.author: Carson Gregory

customer_reviews.title: The phone is so simple that it might not be ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone is so simple that it might not be possible for there to be any faults (other than if it didn't work at all). At a price of ten dollars, the only sensible rating is five stars. It operates exactly as expected - basic, simple, reliable and with zero pretensiousness.
customer_reviews.author: JmG

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement Phone
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble with Indian support people complaining about not being able to hear me clearly. Since I got this phone, I have had no more problems, and the volume is now sufficient to allow the scammers to hear me telling them to go jump in a lake. If I had to complain about anything, the ring tone, even the one that resembles the old fashioned tone, is a little on the shrill side. SF
customer_reviews.author: Lord Balto

customer_reviews.title: A really good solid cheap phone.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a cheap well built reliable phone look no further. I have had one of these in my house for several years and it has never given me any problems. I was surprised to see that they still sell them because every thing seems to be going cordless which is of no use if your power goes out. I always need one or two phones in my house that work regardless of power outages or cell phone towers being down and this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: RobbygTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not so good as a wall phone
customer_reviews.text: They say it can be used as a wall phone, but the handset will not stay on the base when its on the wall. Quite disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Got it in February. Working well so far. A bit cheap seeming than I expected, but it makes for a lighter phone. It does not have a speaker setting, but if you set the handset on "loud", then, I can hear it well enough if I am near by, so I do not have to hold the phone up while I am made to wait half an hour for a customer-service actual person to pick up. Easy to use. Sound quality seems to be good. I can hear well. I got no complaints from people on the other end.
customer_reviews.author: Dandy Mandy

customer_reviews.title: She said she really liked it and commented on how lightweight it is
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Mom who is a diehard landliner with a collection of frakensteined phones that were all dying and no more extra parts to fix them. She said she really liked it and commented on how lightweight it is, easy for her to move around. Sound quality is good on both ends of the line. This phone was a gift to her so she would have a backup phone during power outages or if the cordless phone I also bought her was out of juice.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: loud and clear sound with medium volume setting.  Just push number, and it will call.
customer_reviews.text: I set the volume control to the medium level, which gives me loud and clear sound. I would hate to try the loudest level. This is a basic slender phone that takes little real estate. Light weight. Speed dial is not practical on this phone since there is no window to see whom I am calling. I tried to put in numbers but it didn't work anyway. This is a good phone to manually push buttons to call out. Can't expect much more for the price. Simple is sometimes the best. Just push the number, and it will call.
customer_reviews.author: A hiker

customer_reviews.title: needed a backup phone
customer_reviews.text: I needed a backup phone for my elderly mother- this fit the bill. Worked great during the last power outage- really nice to have the old phones that don't need batteries on a land line.
customer_reviews.author: NJJTSum

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I had a funky desk/wall combo phone on my kitchen wall, but the wall mount was not compatible with the phone mounting holes, so it always hung crooked. I wanted clean lines and a phone that will work during a power outage (i have traditional copper wire phone service) and this satisfies my requirements. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: dadshop2000

customer_reviews.title: Good phone.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is sturdy and has a good solid weight to it. It has no battery and runs off the phone line. i have over ip phone service and it works perfect. The keys light up with a low light. It has very good volume which is settable by a thumb switch. Its old school att quality. i like it. Thank You for a nice phone at an excellent price !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but can't mount on wall
customer_reviews.text: The phone works, but the receiver doesn't stay on the hook when it is mounted on the wall. I have a standard wall mount phone jack and the phone comes equipped to be placed on the wall. When I hooked it into the screws on the wall mount, the receiver just kept falling off. Bottom line, the phone works as it should without electrical power so it's a good backup if you need to use the phone when the power goes out, but it won't mount on the wall properly.
customer_reviews.author: JasonS

customer_reviews.title: AT&T TRIMLINE CLASSIC LANDLINE TELEPHONE (BLACK)
customer_reviews.text: Our Florida house experiences tropical storm and hurricanes periodically. If the electricity goes out, I discovered that our landline cordless phones won’t work due to the units needing electricity. As a result, I purchased a few landline phones that don’t require electricity and will still work during a power outage. These AT&T TRIMLINE classic phones are great to use as a standby phone. I have them installed in my home office, laundry room, garage, and bathrooms. The only thing I didn’t like was that they don’t have Caller ID built in, but that’s why it’s a classic!
customer_reviews.author: ShopGirl

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: I would have given the phone 5 stars, but it is very lightweight... a little more weight would help it stay put better. Might try gluing some fishing sinkers to the bottom. Other than that, it is exactly what I need...the ringer can be turned off, it has a volume control, the number pad lights up...and most importantly, it works when the electrical power goes out. The cord also keeps it from being carried about the house and misplaced.
customer_reviews.author: HOS 61

customer_reviews.title: I WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: The phone is too cheaply made. We needed one for a replacement from our kitchen wall but the hanger that catches the phone to keep it hanging on the wall is a $0.02 piece of cheap plastic and will not hold the phone so it really can only be used for a desktop which is not what we needed it for. I could not in good faith recommend this as a Wholphin. When I complain to Amazon they going to make me pay the shipping to send it back and it's the $0.02 piece of plastic the whole the phone on the wall that's the real problem but it is chiefly made you can tell you decide.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W. Anderton

customer_reviews.title: If you need an analog phone this is it
customer_reviews.text: If you need an analog phone this is it. When ever the power goes out. Now a lot in California This analog phone works great. We have a digital cordless phone but it goes out during power outages. So if we need to make a phone emergency phone calls during a power outage, just plug in this analog phone to use.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen Anthony-tabar

customer_reviews.title: Great phone when electricity is down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in preparation for hurricane season, since this phones does not require power. It works very well I ordered black color, which came as described. The sound quality is great. No static can be heard on the line. I am able to adjust the volume up and down. I have purchased other phones which have not worked as well. Overall, very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: Has a very odd sound. I bought this for my office in case the phone rings while I am in there. It's fine for that but I would recommend a better quality phone for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for forgetful, aging dad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this landline phone for my aging father in a nursing care facility. With dementia issues, he kept forgetting to return his old, battery-powered phone to the charging base. I could never reach him until I gave him this “old style” phone. A lifesaver for reliable communication with my dad!
customer_reviews.author: Nanny fan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and just delivery response but the item shouldn’t be left beside the street.
customer_reviews.text: I like the item and it suits the right phone I need. Although the hook secures the phone as it hangs on the wall, it is holding the set alittle tight but ok. Only what I don’t like is that I found the package leaning on the foot of my mailbox at the streetside and anybody walking on the street can easily pick it up. Delivery is not handed personally, that’s a big lie. I myself can prove it. It should be delivered in front of my entrance door. Another thing to learn about unsecured delivery. Watche out!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Polintan

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Phone!
customer_reviews.text: This phone was perfect for my parents who are in assisted living and can no longer operate a cordless phone. With this phone they only need to lift the receiver and say "hello" to be connected with family and friends. It was easy to set up, just plug into the phone jack. It fits comfortably in your hand, and rests securely on the base. This would be a great phone to have for power outages when the batteries in cordless phones die. If you are using for that purpose, make sure you have a traditional phone line, not VOIP.
customer_reviews.author: AmznLuver

customer_reviews.title: Great very basic phone.
customer_reviews.text: I am one of those people who still has a landline and I like this phone because there is not battery that needs to be recharged, and it works even if the electricity is down. I love the convenience of a cordless phone (and I have one), but this phone is great when the cordless phone cannot be used during a blackout.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This is One Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: Well I Love everything, about my New phone. I love the old school looks ans as said. before you can't beat . the copper wire. and I am so happy that i don't have the Bloody voice mail to contend with maybe it's my age but i so love things from the 60's..... the phone is clear without buzz and clutter. Thank You att.com and amazon. you Rock.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Gibson-Zeigler III

customer_reviews.title: Good for Old People
customer_reviews.text: The ringer is loud enough. The buttons are large and spaced apart. It is a very basic phone. I like that no battery or electricity backup is required. Sooner or later, the phone is going to get knocked off the desk/table and break. So! Do I want to replace an expensive phone or a cheaper phone. I choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Old Warrior Woman

customer_reviews.title: Not good as a wall phone.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a wall phone. Should have paid more attention to reviewers. It definitely does not stay in the cradle when on the wall - isn't just loose - it just falls out. It looks nice and sounds nice as a table phone which is all it is good for. I will use it as a table phone and keep on looking for a wall phone that works properly. Sep 17 - Have to revise my review - Someone who knows more about phones than I do figured out that there is a little notch on the underside that makes it stay in the cradle. It now works very well.
customer_reviews.author: josie

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a previous wall mounted phone that was dropped. The phone was easily replaced by this unit and worked fine from time of plugin. Haven't confirmed that this will function in case of power failure but other seems to work as described. Only complaint was somewhat meager installation instructions especially for rotating hook for using phone as wall unit.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Salzman

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a corded phone; however, I forgot how pretty awful Trimline phones were. And this is a more modern rendition, meaning it has the same thin sounding tinniness and poor sound quality you get on many cheap wireless phones. Pretty much you get what you pay for with this. Reserve any recommendation other than for the person who wants a corded phone that is under 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Golden

customer_reviews.title: Phone works great for my elderly blind mother...
customer_reviews.text: My mother needs something simple that she can operate with her hands only. This phone has good volume and is comfortable for here. Telephone discussions are all she really has now, so she depends on this phone - has simple speed dial features that really help her stay in touch. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: C. Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Plain-Jane phone works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this plain-jane corded phone because my landline sometimes gets in a funk, and I needed something to plug in at the service box to check whether the problem is inside my house or out on the grid. (My previous plain-jane phone had gone bad.) What I like about this phone is that all the technology is in the handset itself, nothing in the base; therefore I don't need to carry the base out to the box with me. What I don't like about it is the bulky handset. But, I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival.  No quality control.  Flimsy construction.  Chinese made junk.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed another corded wall phone and I have two AT&T model 210 phones that have worked without a problem for many years. This one has an AT&T logo but is made in China by a company I never heard of. It is lighter and did not work out of the box. It seems that AT&T has given up on quality and is licensing its name to cheap manufacturers. I purchased a used "vintage" AT&T model 210 phone on Ebay for about $20 and it works perfectly even though it is over 20 years old.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old land line phone that the sound quality had deteriorated to the point it was useless. This phone is a great deal
customer_reviews.author: A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Used for a play phone in sons kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I did not order this to use as a landline phone, I ordered this because my son ask if he could have a phone in the play kitchen I had built him. This was exactly what I neede at a great price. I installed it as a wall hang (READ the instructions for wall hanging, you have to make an adjustment so the receiver holds to the base.) I did not attach the cord, but otherwise it’s a real phone that he can use and play with.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie M.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Tired of these new phones that are made so cheap and weightless they not only sound terrible but a good sneeze will blow them across the table and answering a call will invariably drag the base over the edge? Then this may be your answer. It's solid, much heavier the others in its price range and it sounds great. Worth the money and worth your time if you're looking for a nicely constructed, good sounding desk or wall phone. There's a trick to hang it for wall use, but the method has been documented here by other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: SaucerHead

customer_reviews.title: Good price for hard to find item
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these about a month ago, as finding corded phones locally was impossible. One of them works without a hitch. I did substitute a longer cord in the other, and it occasionally loses the dial tone. The phones are very lightweight, I hope AT&T does still mean quality. The 1 phone with problems has worsened- does not work at all currently.
customer_reviews.author: Rochel

customer_reviews.title: Want a phone that rings? Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old AT&T Trimline phone. That phone lasted for well over a decade and only needed to be replaced because the wall mount on the back cracked. Taking this out of the box I immediately noticed it was MUCH lighter than the original. The sound quality is okay but the ringer does not work. Kinda hard to answer the phone when it never makes a sound! Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hogg

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this phone for anyone wanting just a basic landline ...
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the AT&T 210M Trimline Corded Phone... I just wanted a cheap phone I could use for troubleshooting my phone line and cordless phone. My cordless phone wasn’t ringing when i receive an incoming call and I couldn’t determine if it was the phone line or the phone itself. After using this AT&T phone it still wouldn’t ring so I guess it was the phone line. I also use this as a backup when the cordless phone dies or when the power is out. I would highly recommend this phone for anyone wanting just a basic landline corded phone.
customer_reviews.author: Erick D.

customer_reviews.title: Simple phone that just works
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone to pair with my Obi100 VoIP box. It allows me to make free calls over the internet and works great. There's not a lot of features on it, but that's just less crap to break I suppose. It's got speed dial, a volume adjuster and can be hooked to the wall, that's about it other than calling. In any case, I attached it to the side of my desk and it's worked like a charm for about a year now. Good call quality, high volume, it's very sturdy (I've hit it on the desk a few times sitting on hold), and has a nice look. If you just want something cheap and simple, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful
customer_reviews.text: We needed a replacement for an already existing wall mounted phone (cordless was not an option for this space) and were happy to find an old standard AT&T online at Amazon. This phone lacks the sleeker lines of the Princess phone (this one is boxier), but it does the job. Thanks to a previous reviewer for illustrating how to 1) locate the hanger tab and 2) how to install it, so that the hand piece hooks on and stays on. Good value for a basic, Old Faithful landline phone.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with newer phone systems.
customer_reviews.text: This phone will work fine if you have an old POTS telephone network connection, but it will not function if you have a newer fiber optics one with an ethernet connection, that contains no inline DC power. I subsequently purchases 2 UPS's that will power our router and current digital phone system, as well as charge our cellphones and other emergency devices.
customer_reviews.author: ThriftyOne

customer_reviews.title: Keys don’t light up as promised
customer_reviews.text: Really cheaply constructed. Only a few of the keys light up so if you have an emergency you still have to go fumble for the light switch. It’s so annoying, it’s money down the drain because it’s gotten on my nerves so much I’ll just eat the cost and buy a better phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Quality despite the price.
customer_reviews.text: The year is 2016, and i bought "ancient" technology. But i knew what i was buying. I used to work at a small electronics store, and at that time, we sold a lot of corded and cordless phones. This was the only model we sold that never came back as a return. People liked that it was simple, decently comfortable, the speaker was good quality, the receiver held firmly to the base, and the phone just doesn't take up much space or break easily. So i bought one, and am very pleased with the quality of this inexpensive phone.
customer_reviews.author: Eric the BBQ guy

product_meta.title: AT&T 210 Basic Trimline Corded Phone, No AC Power Required, Wall-Mountable, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:BlackA popular and affordable telephone, the 210M from AT&T is designed for those who don't want hassles or frills, just a basic phone that's reliable and easy to use. Simple corded operation means you never have worry about misplacing a cordless handset, and the phone's sturdy construction means it's designed to last.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description A popular and affordable telephone, the 210 from AT&T is designed for those who don't want hassles or frills, just a basic phone that's reliable and easy to use. Simple corded operation means you never have worry about misplacing a cordless handset, and the phone's sturdy construction means it's designed to last. You can place the base on a convenient surface or easily mount it on the wall, saving on counter space. A 13-number memory dial feature lets you store your most frequently called numbers (up to 21 digits)--nine speed dials plus three emergency one-touch dials that are easy to program. A directory card is provided to help you keep track of all your memory dial settings. A redial feature lets you quickly call the last outgoing number (up to 32 digits). Three ringer settings (off, low, and high) and three handset volume levels permit customization. Switchable tone and pulse dialing methods are also provided. The illuminated keypad helps you operate the phone even in darkly lit areas, while a prog/mute button on the handset lets you hear the other party while muting your side of the conversation. An excellent value, the 210 also comes backed with a one-year limited warranty. What's in the Box: Telephone handset, telephone base, 7-foot line cord, coiled handset cord, user's manual, warranty information

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars7,425 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
